meanings.definition: A large sack used for holding wool.
meanings.sent1: The farmer carried the heavy woolsacks to the storage shed.
meanings.sent2: The woolsacks were neatly stacked in the barn.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog thought the woolsacks were giant pillows to jump on.
meanings.sent4: The woolsacks in the field resembled fluffy clouds against the blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The woolsacks smelled of lanolin and sheep, filling the room with a cozy scent.

meanings.definition: A large quantity of wool packed in a sack.
meanings.sent1: The market was bustling with vendors selling colorful woolsacks.
meanings.sent2: The weaver needed more woolsacks to complete the project.
meanings.sent3: The woolsacks spilled out of the truck, creating a soft and fluffy roadblock.
meanings.sent4: The woolsacks in the warehouse formed a mountain of wool waiting to be spun.
meanings.sent5: The woolsacks absorbed the sunlight, making them appear even softer and more inviting.
